Since the type is being promoted to a public API, are Doxygen comments for the public and protected functions something that should be added to capture to "contract" of the type apart from its current implementation?

```
[trickle] No significant performance differences
```

```
[microbenchmarks] Performance differences noted:
Benchmark                                                                                cpu_time    real_time
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  ----------  -----------
BM_HasClearGrpcStatus<ErrorWithGrpcStatus>                                               -7%         -7%
BM_StreamingPingPong<MinInProcess, NoOpMutator, NoOpMutator>/262144/2                    -8%         -8%
BM_StreamingPingPongWithCoalescingApi<InProcess, NoOpMutator, NoOpMutator>/262144/2/0    -7%         -7%
BM_StreamingPingPongWithCoalescingApi<MinInProcess, NoOpMutator, NoOpMutator>/32768/2/1  -8%         -8%
BM_UnaryPingPong<MinInProcess, NoOpMutator, NoOpMutator>/0/262144                        +4%         +4%
```

@chwarr : Absolutely! Promoting this to public will be done in coordination with its [gRFC](https://github.com/grpc/proposal/pull/61) and we'd encourage any comments to help shape the final form of these classes in the discussion thread.
